citation.article-title: Description of Olleya aquimaris sp. nov., isolated from seawater, and emended description of the genus Olleya Mancuso Nichols et al. 2005
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Olleya aquimaris sp. nov.
Olleya aquimaris (a.qui.ma′ris. L. n. aqua water; L. gen. n. maris of the sea; N.L. gen. n. aquimaris of seawater).
Cells are Gram-stain-negative, non-flagellated, non-endospore-forming and rod-shaped (0.5–0.6 μm in diameter and 0.6–3.5 μm long).
Motile by gliding.
Strictly aerobic.
Flexirubin-type pigments are not produced.
Colonies on MA are circular, raised to slightly convex, glistening, smooth, yellow and 0.8–2.2 mm in diameter after incubation for 3 days at 37 °C.
Optimal growth at 37 °C; growth occurs at 4 and 40 °C, but not at 45 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is between 6.5 and 7.0; growth occurs at pH 6.0, but not at pH 5.5.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0.5–7.0 % (w/v) NaCl with optimum growth at approximately 2.0 % (w/v) NaCl.
Mg2+ ions are required for growth.
Catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Aesculin, casein, gelatin, starch and Tweens 20, 40, 60 and 80 are hydrolysed, but CM-cellulose, hypoxanthine, l-tyrosine, urea, xanthine and xylan are not.
Acetoin, H2S and indole are not produced.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-6.
The major polar lipids are an unidentified aminolipid and two unidentified lipids.
The major cellular fatty acids (>10 % of the total fatty acids) are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 1, iso-C16 : 0 3-OH and iso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1.
The type strain is L-4T (=KCTC 22661T =CCUG 58074T), isolated from seawater of Baekdo harbour in the East Sea, Korea.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 35 mol%.
